I‚Äôve put around 10 hours into Blood Strike so far and I‚Äôve had a ton of fun, especially running duos with my bro. The gameplay feels fast, responsive, and always exciting ‚Äî every match has those intense moments that keep us coming back. The gunplay is satisfying, the map design is solid, and it nails that ‚Äúone more round‚Äù feeling. Overall, Blood Strike has been a blast to play and is easy to recommend if you enjoy squad shooters and high-energy action.

The Skins are nice and have some really nice models with a well made menu, then you load in... and everything feels like it should be running on a 2010 hardware, which isn't a deal breaker by any means just something to be aware of.

After nearly 300 hours of gameplay, I can confidently say I recommend Bloodstrike. The core gameplay is highly engaging, and I've thoroughly enjoyed my time with it. While I believe the game is best when played with a dedicated squad of friends (it definitely enhances the experience), the biggest highlight for me is the robust anti-cheat system and the commitment to fair play. Highly recommended for anyone looking for a fast-paced battle royale experience backed by a dedicated and respectful development team.

Been playing Bloodstrike for a long time, it's pretty fun, movement is pretty buggy but can be used for competitive advantage, graphics are pretty mid but it's the most optimized game I've ever played in my life!
even on a toaster you could get stable 144 fps!

What I loved:
-Skins: They're pretty cheap and really good looking
-Collabs: They often do many collabs, making the game feel refreshing every once in a while!
-Optimization: Overall this game is super optimized and stable, even on low end hardware
-Global chat: Really good if you need tips on how to get better (or ur mom insulted)
-Guns customization: I liked the fact that I could add a better scope or a lighter magazine on my guns
-Kill animations: pretty self explanatory

What I didn't like:
-Maps: they're limited, and very small and repetitive sometimes
-Guns: they are the same repetitive guns but at least they have many skins and you can customize them!

What should be added:
-More guns: even useless ones would make the game slightly better
-New movement animations: or at least make them smoother, do NOT change the speed or any function
-Bigger and better maps: would make the game more enjoyable and not boring after playing for 2 hours
-Ray Tracing: Would make it a better experience for high end users
-Console Editions: I would love to see a console edition in the future (obviously with crossplay option)

Rates:
Fun: 9/10
Gameplay: 9.5/10
Graphics: 7/10
Performance: 10/10
Overall Rate: 9/10

Give it a try, it's free! (and it works on proton too)

I love this game. Truly, I love this game. HOWEVER, as someone who just got their first PC less than a year ago and grew up on controller, well, I obviously play controller. 

Controller support is horrid. I've messed around in shooting range playing M&K and the input delay for controller compared to M&K is SERIOUS, not to mention there is ZERO, and I mean ZERO aim assist for PC controller players. Shooting with the mouse is a beam, just a 0 recoil beam and that leads to native M&K players having 2+ advantages over PC controller. I need to specify PC controller players because those who play on Mobile, do get aim assist even when using a controller. 

This creates an endless loop of M&K moving faster and aiming better, whereas Mobile can stick to anyone and be fine. This is NOT a problem until you play competitive. Once you hit Legend, now Mythic where all the sweats are ( me kinda being one ) you are at a severe disadvantage no matter who you come across. This becomes increasingly frustrating when there are entire clans who share hacks that never seem to be banned. Wanna see 1 person wipe 8 people in 10 seconds? it happens when they shoot bullets behind themselves without hardly looking at the target. I also have ample footage of people aiming 2-5 feet left, right, up, or straight at the ground and getting nothing but hits.  As good as this game is, seems the Devs do not care about the integrity of the game. That being said, it is fun, fast paced, and full of action. Better than any other game out currently with PC controller support and cheating holding it back.

Hope this helps!

I‚Äôve played Blood Strike for quite a while (91 hours and counting), and honestly, it‚Äôs a fun, fast-paced shooter with tons of potential‚Ä¶ but it‚Äôs missing that complete game feeling that titles like Call of Duty Mobile or Fortnite have.

The movement is great ‚Äî smooth slides, jumps, and fast action. The graphics are solid, and the gunplay feels satisfying most of the time. But after a while, you start noticing what‚Äôs missing. There‚Äôs no real variety in modes, and the revive system being the main focus kind of ruins the flow for me. I‚Äôd rather have it as a separate mode, not the default one.

And let‚Äôs talk about luck ‚Äî or better said, the total lack of it. The gacha system is just brutal. I‚Äôve spent over 4,000 gold in this game and haven‚Äôt gotten a single Ultra, not even once. Not even asking for the highest rarity, just something. At this point, I don‚Äôt need luck ‚Äî I need the game to stop acting like it hates me.

Blood Strike could be amazing if it improved the rewards, added more modes, and gave players a bit more motivation to grind. Right now, it feels like a great shooter trapped behind bad luck and limited content.

‚≠ê Verdict:
Fast, fun, and exciting ‚Äî but frustrating when you realize how much it relies on luck and repetition.
Just give me some luck already, and stop making me waste gold on nothing.

Score: 7.5/10

I've been playing Blood Strike on PC via Steam for about half a year now, and the main strength of this game is that it ‚Äútook all the best from the big titles, yet runs on a potato.‚Äù  
Everything we love Apex and Call of Duty for ‚Äî jumps, slides, characters with unique abilities, fast respawns, dynamic gunfights ‚Äî is here, plus stable 220‚Äì240 FPS even on an old rig.

Yes, it‚Äôs a mobile port, so the graphics are simpler and there are some bugs.  
Personally I have zero complaints about the visuals ‚Äî in fast shooters these little things barely register: most people drop everything to minimum for maximum FPS anyway, and here you get perfect smoothness and responsiveness straight out of the box.

Noticeable bugs:  
‚Ä¢ sometimes the enemy model is looking the wrong way while already shooting at you;  
‚Ä¢ in respawn modes (especially deathmatch) you get a short invincibility shield on spawn, but you can still shoot others. It feels weird: you can‚Äôt kill the freshly spawned guy, but he can kill you instantly. It would be much more logical if neither side could shoot until the shield drops.

Still, the PC port turned out great: mouse+keyboard feel excellent, crossplay and voice chat work without issues.  
If you‚Äôre looking for a lightweight, fast-paced shooter with BR, deathmatch and other modes for chill evening sessions, and your PC no longer handles modern AAA titles ‚Äî Blood Strike is an excellent choice.

Game is a copy of Apex with copy and past attatchments from Tarkov (the whole Sig Sauer thing), copy and paste font and item boxes (and sfx) from Warzone. It is a bunch of copy and paste this and that from almost every well performing shooter game...To top it off one of the characters is a rip off the DJ Llama skin from Fortnite ( I believe his name is Frank). Gameplay is fine and shooting mechanincs and physics are direct copies from Warzone as well. If you have a low spec computer though, this is pretty good. But come on, copy and pasting everything into one game..really..at least be a little original. Heck the after game results has the same zoom in animation from R6.

(English Version)
Title: A PC Whale‚Äôs Warning: I Spent $200 (800 PLN) and Deeply Regret It.

I wanted to love Bloodstrike. The first 20 hours were a fantastic, fast-paced FPS experience on PC. Believing in the game's potential, I invested heavily‚Äîover 800 PLN (roughly $200) on skins and battle passes to support its development.

And then, the game "thanked" me.

After approximately 20 hours of play and significant financial investment, a switch flipped. The matchmaking system "promoted" me. I am now exclusively placed in lobbies filled with other paying players‚Äîhardcore "whales" and "sweats." The problem? The overwhelming majority of them are on mobile.

This is where the game completely breaks down for a PC player.

I tested the game on my own iPhone to confirm my suspicions: the mobile aim assist is not a "helper"; it is a borderline lock-on aimbot. It is absurdly strong, requires minimal skill, and completely invalidates the challenge of aiming.

As an average PC player‚Äîsomeone who enjoys the game but doesn't possess professional-level mouse mechanics‚ÄîI am now cannon fodder. My skill with a mouse and keyboard stands zero chance against a system that snaps and sticks to targets automatically. This isn't a "skill gap"; it's a "platform gap" that you have intentionally designed.

The PC port is clearly an unpolished afterthought. It lacks the most basic, fundamental feature for any cross-platform shooter: THE ABILITY TO DISABLE CROSS-PLAY.

You have created a toxic "Pay-to-Suffer" dynamic. I paid you to support your game, and in return, you "punished" me by throwing me into unplayable lobbies where I am farmed by mobile players with built-in aimbots. It is frustrating, demoralizing, and disrespectful to your paying customers on PC.

To the Developers (NetEase): You must understand that you cannot treat your PC player base as second-class citizens. We are not here simply to be "content" for your mobile audience. Address the extreme aim assist imbalance and give PC players the option to opt out of cross-play. If you don't, you will lose your most financially invested players. I deeply regret my purchase.

(Polish Version)

I tu zaczyna siƒô dramat gracza PC.

Jako osoba, kt√≥ra gra na komputerze, ale nie posiada umiejƒôtno≈õci na poziomie e-sportowym, sta≈Çem siƒô darmowym celem. Sprawdzi≈Çem to osobi≈õcie na moim iPhonie ‚Äì asysta celowania (aim assist) w wersji mobilnej jest absolutnie absurdalna. To nie jest "wspomaganie", to jest w zasadzie legalny "aimbot", kt√≥ry przykleja celownik do przeciwnika.

Deceiving your playerbase with a collab that is region locked with no mention of it anywhere in your Global/English social media accounts for the entire marketing period and no official statements or FAQ or really any info  at all is not cool

This is genuinely upsetting news for me and other people who were looking forward to this, I would've loved to support them and show interest in this kind of collabs or events due to personal and sentimental reasons of mine and since I like and enjoy to some extents this game, but they couldn't even bother to let us know that most of us won't even get to enjoy it AT ALL (except for some in-match elements)

Don't even bother trying to play this game. I thought it was a good game at first. But, it has to be filled with cheaters. People can kill you in less than a second, but it will take you almost five seconds to kill them! I'm so over it! Just trying to find a good and decent alternative to COD that doesn't cost me an arm and a leg. But, I suppose poor people have no good options

I might still give this game a chance but I feel like this game wont be around in a year or two.It kinda reminds me of super mecha champs. Which died for the same reason.. Low player counts and the devs making bots act like players plus massive cash shop. It's also weird that like the bread and butter of cash shops are cosmetics and.. they all suck.

There's also this system of paying for their game to auto slot best in slot attachments you have unlocked for you... Like really? We're monetizing equipment optimization? A basic feature that like RPGMaker games have? lol wtf? Just wtf?

edit: alright I gave it another go till i could enable global chat. As the community responded it's "all bots until higher levels so you can level up guns.." Ok how about we do away with gun leveling advancement and just let people customize out the gate and just limit it to heroes eh? Cause this false sense of skill trap that baits players into a sunk cost fallacy is predatory.

it can be pretty fun tho cuz it is a really easy game.

Game is a copy of Apex with copy and past attatchments from Tarkov (the whole Sig Sauer thing), copy and paste font and item boxes (and sfx) from Warzone. It is a bunch of copy and paste this and that from almost every well performing shooter game...To top it off one of the characters is a rip off the DJ Llama skin from Fortnite ( I believe his name is Frank). Gameplay is fine and shooting mechanincs and physics are direct copies from Warzone as well. If you have a low spec computer though, this is pretty good. But come on, copy and pasting everything into one game..really..at least be a little original. Heck the after game results has the same zoom in animation from R6.

For the gameplay itself, it‚Äôs actually decent, but vehicles still feel very stiff and practically useless in matches ‚Äî this area needs a lot of improvement.

During my 0.6 hours of playtime, I also encountered a bug/unfinished feature: when using a macro auto-click, every weapon I used suddenly had zero recoil. I‚Äôve seen the exact same issue in another legendary battle royale game, but their developers fixed it within less than a week after release. I was honestly surprised that despite this game being out for several months, such a fundamental exploit still hasn‚Äôt been fixed or even noticed by the developers.

At this point, I‚Äôm still hesitant about recommending the game. But based on my overall experience, for now, I‚Äôd lean towards not recommending it.

The worst game of all time. Its not balanced. The bloodstrike team really doesn't care about adding a anti cheat into their game. Hackers are all around most likely in ranked! BloodStrike had potential, but the game feels rushed and unpolished. The servers are unstable, the matchmaking takes forever, and the hit-registration is totally inconsistent. The game is full of bugs, crashes randomly, and the optimization is terrible even on good PCs. On top of that, the gameplay feels unbalanced and pay-to-win, making it frustrating instead of fun. Definitely not worth the time right now.

It‚Äôs frustrating to see the gameplay experience constantly undermined by users resorting to cheats and other forms of unfair play. This situation not only disrupts competitive balance but also devalues the efforts of players who try to improve legitimately. Even more concerning is the apparent inaction from the company responsible, which gives the impression that it isn‚Äôt taking the firm measures needed to curb these practices. In my view, the developer lacks a more rigorous and transparent stance, both in detecting offenders and enforcing proper penalties.
